core.planner
Class Conjunction

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Literal>
              core.planner.Conjunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Standardizable, Substituable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Literal>, java.util.Collection<Literal>, java.util.List<Literal>, java.util.RandomAccess
public final class Conjunction
extends java.util.ArrayList<Literal>
implements Standardizable, Substituable, java.lang.Cloneable

The Conjunction class implements a Conjunction. The class can contain a list of literal objects. It can be seen as a form: (P1 P2 ... Pn) or (:first P1 P2 ... Pn) where the Pi's are literals.

See Also:
Serialized Form

applySubstitution

public java.lang.Object applySubstitution(Substitution alpha,
                                          boolean replaceVar)
                                   throws SubstitutionException
Returns a new Conjunction such that the variables appearing in the Substitution are replaced with the corresponding Term of the Substitution.

Specified by:
applySubstitution in interface Substituable
Parameters:
alpha - the Substitution to apply.
replaceVar - flag to indicate if the Substitution allows to instantiate Variable s not in the Substitution by a Constant with the Variable name.
Returns:
a substituted copy of the Conjunction.
Throws:
SubstitutionException - if an error occur during substitution.
